definition: to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

pinyin: Han2 wu3 ji4 da4 bao4 fa1
Han2 wu3 ji4 sheng1 ming4 da4 bao4 fa1
huo3 shan1 bao4 fa1 zhi3 shu4

sentences.english: The bursts have much more energy than the normal local variations in temperature.
sentences.chinese: 这样的爆发具备相比常规温变强大的多的能量。

sentences.english: That which festers must eventually explode.
sentences.chinese: 溃烂之处最终必须爆发。

sentences.english: An open war between Sweden and Russia broke out in 1554.
sentences.chinese: 1554年，瑞典同露西亚公开爆发战争。

sentences.english: New growth is recurved , like a fiddle-neck.
sentences.chinese: 新的增长爆发，像摆弄颈部。

sentences.english: This very hot aspect could produce angry outbursts.
sentences.chinese: 这个火爆的合相将会带来愤怒的爆发。

sentences.english: At Lava Hot Springs in Idaho, visitors may bathe in the thermal mineral waters.
sentences.chinese: 当热熔岩在爱德荷州爆发，参观者可以去那里泡温泉。

sentences.english: As an argument broke out in Chinese, we felt unbelievably awkward.
sentences.chinese: 一场中国话的争吵爆发时，我们感到难以置信的尴尬。

sentences.english: Or maybe it’s an explosion like nuclear fission.
sentences.chinese: 或者它可以像核裂变一样爆发。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the ending of the story.
sentences.chinese: 在故事的结尾爆发了一阵阵掌声。

sentences.english: In real life there has been just one fatal space depressurisation accident.
sentences.chinese: 在现实生活中只有一起致命的太空爆发性减压事故。

sentences.english: An outbreak of cholera in Haiti continues to spread sickness and worry.
sentences.chinese: 海地霍乱爆发仍在继续传播疾病和忧虑。

sentences.english: Power is the basis of achievement of track and field.
sentences.chinese: 爆发力是多数田径项目取得优异成绩的素质基础。

sentences.english: The mystery is that crises erupt so rarely.
sentences.chinese: 但神秘之处在于，危机的爆发如此罕见。

sentences.english: There were further protests in the coastal city of Hodeida.
sentences.chinese: 沿海城市荷台达也爆发了进一步的抗议活动。

sentences.english: A glof happens when a glacial lake is created by a melting glacier and it then bursts.
sentences.chinese: 融化的冰川形成冰川湖，随后溃决，就会爆发洪水。

sentences.english: Heavy fighting erupted there today after a two-day cease -fire.
sentences.chinese: 在停火两天后，今天那里爆发了激烈的战斗。

definition: to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
could happen at any moment/on the verge
out of control/berserk/to go for a long walk
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
(of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
